intro: Microseris nigrescens, commonly known as the blackening wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters. The species is known for its strong, aromatic scent and its ability to thrive in harsh, low-nutrient conditions.
